page.title: 10Pre War Housing in Locality
page.content: The houses along the Narberth Road are a mixture of Victorian,Edwardian,Post World War I and Post world WarII.The elder buildings have now been turned either into hotels or guest houses.The modern Post World WarII are private.On the North side of the Norton are terraced cottages built in Victorian times for workmen. The croft houses, all without exception,are now hotels, were originally intended as desirable residences for the wealthy people of the town.One of the popular pastimes on a Sunday,up to the commencement of World War I was after Church promenade along this road. Leading from the Croft we come to North cliff with three Victorian houses and a private housing estate, built during the mid 1950's.These houses have superb views over the sea and adjoining coast.
